title: [K-12] UDL-Based Educational Inclusion Design Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational educational theory concepts and online learning platform usage experience
context.additional_context: Targeting pre-service teachers and educators with basic UDL understanding but limited practical application experience; digital tool-enabled environment

learning_goals: Learners can apply the three UDL principles (engagement, representation, action & expression) across diverse educational contexts.
Learners can complete UDL-based lesson design by utilizing the four-stage instructional design engineering method (problem analysis, goal setting, activity design, evaluation).
Learners can propose strategies to enhance educational inclusivity incorporating peer feedback using digital collaboration tools.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
